content: The "Nuclear Terrorism Prevention Act of 2006" is the short title of this Act, which includes definitions for various terms used within the legislation. The Act defines terms such as "Convention on the Physical Protection of Nuclear Material," "design-basis threat," and "formula quantities of strategic special nuclear material." The term "formula quantities of strategic special nuclear material" refers to specific amounts of uranium-235, uranium-233, or plutonium totaling 5,000 grams or more, as defined in section 73.2 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations. The term "Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty" refers to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons. The term "nuclear weapon" refers to any device utilizing atomic energy, excluding the means for transporting or propelling the device. The term "Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty" is the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, signed in 1968 and enforced in 1970. The Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, signed in 1968 and enforced in 1970, defines a nuclear weapon as any device utilizing atomic energy for use as a weapon, prototype, or test device.
